channel.title: SDN-Warrior | Daniel Krieger
channel.description: Recent content on SDN-Warrior | Daniel Krieger

item.title: Homelab V4
item.description:
Ready for VCF

I have done a huge redesign of my Homelab. To better test VCF scenarios, 3 new Minisforum MS-01 have been added. These have a 13th generation i9 and are equipped with fast NVMes for memory tiering. They also have 2x10G and 2x2.5G networking on board for various VM workloads. Furthermore, I converted my storage from NFS to iSCSI with multipathing, which gets even more performance out of my self-built Unraid. I manage about 2 GB/s read / 1.2 GB GB/s write and 78K IOPS (Random 4K with 32Q) in a Windows 11 VM.

item.title: ABOUT ME
item.description:
Hi, Iâ€™m Daniel,

a passionate homelab enthusiast and Software-Defined Networking engineer based in Germany. With a strong focus on VMware technologies, I enjoy exploring the boundaries of virtualization and building innovative solutions in my home lab. This blog is my space to share insights, tips, and projects from my journey in the world of software-defined infrastructure.
